messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): I'm starting to think we should just go ahead and merge Range in
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): Is there much else to do that I am missing?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): Also note it is prerequisite for adding modification listeners
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): does this count as written permission per the license? :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:46): whoa
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:46): https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-core/raw/tip/dom-core.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): isn't this some giant XSS hole in bitbucket?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:50): Ranges is actually pretty big
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:57): yeah something like that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:19): that bitbucket thing is scary. has it been reported to bitbucket?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:20): and bitbucket has been created *after* people were supposed to know about origins
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:26): it looks like a regression
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:27): what is the "Assert:" stuff 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:27): can that be removed?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:28): assert stuff? where?"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:30): Ah. The asserts there are pretty much all just for WebIDL things>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:30): *?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:30): I'd say they don't add anything, then, really.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:46): the DOM Core spec exposed a bug in my new View Source impl...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:49): someone with a good term for "ancestors and the node itself"?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:50): XPath calls it ancestor or self

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:50): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: it appears that I broke the way View Source communicates the charset of the page to the main thread when I fixed https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=675499
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:53): how about "reverse subtree"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:54): (the current term is "ancestor containers")
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (15:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: wouldn't that be a supertree then?
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (15:56): (I guess tree is not a good word to describe it though)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:01): the roof :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:02): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c, it's the best short word so far
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:02): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c, though very novel afaict
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:03): and it might confuse people who are into this: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supertree
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (16:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yea, saw that too
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:05): "subtree" sounds confusing because you'd think it's a tree with branches, when acually it's just a list
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:07): has a book where "ancestor" includes the node itself, and "proper ancestor" doesn't
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:10): subtree is standard terminology
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:10): interesting
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:11): subtree is standard when referring to the tree formed by the descendants of a node, but not when referring to the chain of ancestors, I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:13): we'd use supertree for the the ancestor part
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:14): "supertree" sounds confusing because you'd think it's a tree with branches, when actually it's just a list
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:15): alternatives?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:15): would probably assume the supertree is the largest tree that contains the given node (i.e. the one rooted at the most distant ancestor)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:18): If "ancestor" is already defined to exclude the node itself, "ancestor or self" doesn't sound too bad (it's a bit ugly but short and clear), or maybe "inclusive ancestor"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:21): inclusive ancestor sounds rather clear and works a bit better in this context
efcfdc75e9299f9082b85c6f181b106f (16:24): As someone who has no idea what you guys are talking about, "ancestor and self" is much easier to understand than "inclusivve ancestor"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:27): true enough, but understanding this term is the least of your worries when you implement range

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:27): The term (and "ancestor" by itself) should be linked to a precise definition, so I guess it's not too bad if people have to click the link to find what you mean
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:28): (It'd be worse if they thought they knew what it meant, so they didn't check the definition, but actually had the wrong idea)
efcfdc75e9299f9082b85c6f181b106f (16:29): "Let's name it something nobody will be certain to understand and force them to look for the proper definition"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:29): Call it "concept #382"
efcfdc75e9299f9082b85c6f181b106f (16:29): That needs some usability testing :p

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:32): Then you just define "Concept #382: A concept #53 that is the target concept #53 or a concept #197 of it", and "Concept #197: A concept #53 that is a concept #382 of the target concept #53 but is not the target concept #53 itself", etc
efcfdc75e9299f9082b85c6f181b106f (16:33): And throw in some false links to make sure they're paying attention and not just clicking along.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:49): I guess I should land Range before I make too many changes so people can follow on what is being changed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:58): went from 37 to 44 pages
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:59): Should 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 become co-editor of DOM Core now? I guess that would be a bit too unwieldy
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:59): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: shouldn't it be s/and/or/ in https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-core/changeset/e126979296ce ?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): why?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:08): hmm. so IGs "endorse" bugs
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: because it now says that objects that implements all of those interfaces are nodes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: whereas if an object implements only one of them is not a node
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:19): thanks
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:28): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, if you feel like updating Selection for your changes... ;)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:28): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2011Sep/0004.html
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:29): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, go ahead and merge Range in, sounds good to me.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:30): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, I was about to say, and then I got that email, damnit
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:30): Don't take the Selection stuff, obviously.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:30): right
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:30): I haven't
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:30): I'll take that at some point soonish.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:30): Oh, I see, you took it already.
